TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: ti sa Pułałuyałuyan kati sa Simidalu (Qatsiłay village p.157)

S.FORM: uzai ka sitsuayan ti sa Pułałuyałuyan, navaik a kiseqas tua se Tjuavudas.
ozai ka sicoayan ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan, navaik a kiseqas toa se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there was a man called Pułałuyałuyan, who went to fight the Tjuavudas people.

S.FORM: nakuya aravats a sikudan nua se Tjuavudas a tsautsau; tsug a tsemakaw; marka semqas tua tsautsau.
nakoya aravac a sikodan noa se Tjoavodas a caocao; cog a cemakaw; marka semqas toa caocao.
S.TRANSL: The Tjuavudas people were very bad; they were fond of stealing and of killing people.

S.FORM: qau limutseng ti sa Pułałuyałuyan; mirava, sa vaik a kiseqas tua se Tjuavudas.
qao limoceng ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan; mirava, sa vaik a kiseqas toa se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan was angry. He got ready, and went to fight the Tjuavudas people.

S.FORM: qau djemałun itjua qinałan nua se Tjuavudas.
qao djemaljon itjoa qinaljan noa se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: He got to the village of the Tjuavudas people,

S.FORM: kiseqasan ni sa Pułałuyałuyan a se Tjuavudas a lima a qadaw.
kiseqasan ni sa Poljaljoyaljoyan a se Tjoavodas a lima a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: and fought against them for five days.

S.FORM: łakua matsidił ti sa Pułałuyałuyan, tjuruvu a se Tjuavudas.
ljakoa macidilj ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan, tjorovo a se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: But Pułałuyałuyan was on his own, and there were lots of the Tjuavudas people.

S.FORM: qau ini vala ti sa Pułałuyałuyan; qetsiin anga nua se Tjuavudas.
qao ini vala ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan; qeciin anga noa se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan couldn’t win, and he was killed by the Tjuavudas people.

S.FORM: qau sa tseludju-i anga tua kavayan a qulu katua tsuqelał.
qao sa celodjo-i anga toa kavayan a qolo katoa coqelalj.
S.TRANSL: And his head and skeleton were impaled on bamboo spikes.

S.FORM: manu uzai a ałak ni sa Pułałuyałuyan, ti sa Simidalu a ngadan.
mano ozai a aljak ni sa Poljaljoyaljoyan, ti sa Simidalo a ngadan.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan had a child called Simidalu.

S.FORM: qau meqatsa azua; kivadaq tua kina: "tima ku kama?
qao meqaca azoa; kivadaq toa kina: "tima ko kama?
S.TRANSL: He grew up, and asked his mother: “Mother, who is my father?

S.FORM: aku neka ku kama i tjumaq?" ayain a kina.
ako neka ko kama i tjomaq?" ayain a kina.
S.TRANSL: Why is my father not here at home?” he said to his mother.

S.FORM: łakua marekutj a kina a tjemumał tu qintsi nua se Tjuavudas; marekutj tu vaik anan a kikuang tua se Tjuavudas.
ljakoa marekotj a kina a tjemomalj to qinci noa se Tjoavodas; marekotj to vaik anan a kikoang toa se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: But his mother was afraid to tell him that his father had been killed by Tjuavudas people; she was afraid that he too would go and fight the Tjuavudas people.

S.FORM: łakua manu vaik a kivadaq tua qaliqali ti sa Simidalu.
ljakoa mano vaik a kivadaq toa qaliqali ti sa Simidalo.
S.TRANSL: But Simidalu went and asked others,

S.FORM: manu tjumałan nua qaliqali.
mano tjomaljan noa qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: and they told him.

S.FORM: qau kemłang anga ti sa Simidalu tu qintsi a kama nua se Tjuavudas.
qao kemljang anga ti sa Simidalo to qinci a kama noa se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: So now Simidalu knew that his father had been killed by the Tjuavudas people.

S.FORM: "nu maitazua vaik aken a kiqułis tua se Tjuavudas," aya kinemnem.
"no maitazoa vaik aken a kiqoljis toa se Tjoavodas," aya kinemnem.
S.TRANSL: “In that case I’ll go and get revenge on the Tjuavudas people,” he thought.

S.FORM: qau ini tjumał tua kina; vaik timadju a sema tjua qinałan nua se Tjuavudas, sa kikuangi a se Tjuavudas.
qao ini tjomalj toa kina; vaik timadjo a sema tjoa qinaljan noa se Tjoavodas, sa kikoangi a se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: He didn’t tell his mother; he went to the village of the Tjuavudas people and fired on them.

S.FORM: azua ti sa Simidalu saigu aravats a kiseqas.
azoa ti sa Simidalo saigo aravac a kiseqas.
S.TRANSL: Simidalu was a very skilful fighter.

S.FORM: qau ini anga vala a se Tjuavudas.
qao ini anga vala a se Tjoavodas.
S.TRANSL: The Tjuavudas people couldn’t win.

S.FORM: qau djumaken a tsuqelał katua qulu nua kama, a sinipatseludju tua kavayan.
qao djomaken a coqelalj katoa qolo noa kama, a sinipacelodjo toa kavayan.
S.TRANSL: He found his father’s skeleton and head, impaled on bamboo spikes.

S.FORM: qau alapen nimadju sa pałeteku-i, sa qepu-i a tsuqelał.
qao alapen nimadjo sa paljeteko-i, sa qepo-i a coqelalj.
S.TRANSL: He took them down and collected up the bones.

S.FORM: qau sa kisenayi nimadju: "kuda mapatsatsaitsaing a tsuqelał ni kama."
qao sa kisenayi nimadjo: "koda mapacacaicaing a coqelalj ni kama."
S.TRANSL: And he chanted over them: “May father’s bones join together!”

S.FORM: qau mapatsatsaitsaing a tsuqelał nua kama.
qao mapacacaicaing a coqelalj noa kama.
S.TRANSL: And his father’s bones joined together.

S.FORM: "kuda puseti ti kama."
"koda poseti ti kama."
S.TRANSL: “May flesh come on my father’s body!”

S.FORM: puseti a kama.
poseti a kama.
S.TRANSL: Flesh came on his father’s body.

S.FORM: "kuda kiłavaran ti kama."
"koda kiljavaran ti kama."
S.TRANSL: “May father speak!”

S.FORM: kiłavaran a kama.
kiljavaran a kama.
S.TRANSL: His father spoke.

S.FORM: qau mevałut anga a kama.
qao mevaljot anga a kama.
S.TRANSL: His father had come back to life.

S.FORM: qau miravanga tiamadju; qau sa vaik anga tjumaq.
qao miravanga tiamadjo; qao sa vaik anga tjomaq.
S.TRANSL: So they got ready and went back home.

S.FORM: qau djemałun i gadegade.
qao djemaljon i gadegade.
S.TRANSL: They got to the mountain ridge.

S.FORM: penanang ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
penanang ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan gave a victory shout.

S.FORM: qau lemangda a i tjumaq.
qao lemangda a i tjomaq.
S.TRANSL: The people at home heard it.

S.FORM: "aku uzai azua penanang?
"ako ozai azoa penanang?
S.TRANSL: “Why is someone giving a victory shout?

S.FORM: matu ti sa Pułałuyałuyan," aya a qaliqali.
mato ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan," aya a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: It sounds like Pułałuyałuyan,” people said.

S.FORM: penanang uta ti sa Simidalu.
penanang ota ti sa Simidalo.
S.TRANSL: Simidalu also gave a shout,

S.FORM: qau langdan nua qaliqali.
qao langdan noa qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: and was heard by the other people.

S.FORM: "aku uzai azua sinipanang?
"ako ozai azoa sinipanang?
S.TRANSL: “What is there to give a victory shout about?

S.FORM: matu ti sa Simidalu," aya a qaliqali.
mato ti sa Simidalo," aya a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: It sounds like Simidalu,” people said.

S.FORM: qau viliviliłan anga penanang anga tiamadju a maḍusa.
qao vilivililjan anga penanang anga tiamadjo a madrosa.
S.TRANSL: Finally they both shouted together.

S.FORM: mintu sa lingułan nua qułivangeraw tu masan limał.
minto sa lingoljan noa qoljivangeraw to masan limalj.
S.TRANSL: Then they were surrounded by five rainbows.

S.FORM: qau vaik tiamadju a tjumaq.
qao vaik tiamadjo a tjomaq.
S.TRANSL: They went on to their home.

S.FORM: djemałun tiamadju; kamayan anan a qułivangeraw.
djemaljon tiamadjo; kamayan anan a qoljivangeraw.
S.TRANSL: They arrived, and the rainbows were still there.

S.FORM: qau mangtjez a qaliqali a kiqenetj, sa pakaleva-i anga tiamadju a maḍusa.
qao mangtjez a qaliqali a kiqenetj, sa pakaleva-i anga tiamadjo a madrosa.
S.TRANSL: So others came to see, and the two of them were welcomed.

S.FORM: qau zemian a qaliqali a tapuluq a qadaw; marka kevava.
qao zemian a qaliqali a tapoloq a qadaw; marka kevava.
S.TRANSL: People danced for ten days and drank beer.

S.FORM: qau sa san mamazangiłani anga ti sa Pułałuyałuyan kati sa Simidalu.
qao sa san mamazangiljani anga ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan kati sa Simidalo.
S.TRANSL: And they made Pułałuyałuyan and Simidalu chiefs.
